name: Evgeny Igumnov
notes:
I have been a software developer for 27 years since I graduated from Novosibirsk State Technical University in 1996 with a degree in Software Engineering.
My first job after university was with Le Petit Fute where I worked as a Perl developer from 1996 to 2001. I helped build their website and designed the database structure.
 In 2001, I moved to Geocad as a Java developer. I worked on backend development and database optimization. I specialized in performance and scalability.
 After 7 years at Geocad, in 2007 I founded my own company called MyLivePage where I was the owner and lead PHP developer. I built the core CMS system and provided highload expertise by optimizing SQL queries and implementing caching.
 In 2014, I left MyLivePage and joined Jetico as a Rust developer where I currently work today. At Jetico, I've built document search and indexing engines using Rust, Actix, Tokio and other modern technologies. I also developed a license server in Rust. 
 In summary, I have over 27 years of experience in software development, spanning early technologies like Perl to modern stacks using Rust. I have expertise in backend systems, databases, performance and scalability.
